problem: 35% of fashion e-commerce orders are returned.
€50B+ wasted per year in logistics, unsold stock and reconditioning.
No precise fit, no textile physics, no emotion → lost sales.
solution: Parametric 3D Avatar calibrated to the user body.
Fabric-Aware Fit Comparator (silhouette deviation, strain/contact maps).
CAP: Auto-generation of new garments if catalog mismatch.
JIT: Secure factory orchestration from file-to-delivery.
claims8: 1. System — A unified computer-implemented system combining (i) 3D parametric avatar fitting; (ii) fabric-aware comparator with physics-based fit scoring; (iii) emotion- and trend-driven ranking; (iv) creative auto‑production (CAP) that emits production‑ready assets when catalog items fail thresholds; (v) dual‑biometric transaction approval (iris + voice with liveness); and (vi) JIT factory orchestration with secure status callbacks.
2. Avatar — The avatar is generated from single/multi‑image capture using anthropometric priors and calibrated to user measurements; real-time cloth simulation renders drape and contact.

3. Fit Score — The fit score f combines normalized silhouette deviation, predicted strain/relaxation per textile elasticity, and contact/penetration penalties, indexed per garment class and tolerance.
4. Textile Index — Garment catalogs are indexed by pattern, tolerance, elasticity and style metadata; the comparator retrieves top‑k per class with tunable thresholds.
5. CAP — Upon no garment meeting threshold, CAP generates a new garment design with parametric pattern files, seam allowances and color‑managed print assets, embedding metadata for traceability.
6. ABVET — Payment approval requires dual-biometric authentication with voiceprint and iris scan including liveness checks; fused risk score gates transaction tokens.
7. Orchestration — The JIT engine transmits production assets to certified factories via a secure interface, enforces latency SLAs and captures status events: queued, cutting, sewing, QA, shipped.

8. Telemetry & Adaptation — The system logs fit outcomes, returns and user interactions, adapting models over time and updating recommendations; APIs are embeddable and version‑tracked (Git) across partner platforms.
